intro: Sida polyantha, commonly known as the common sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from summer to autumn. Its roots are fibrous, and it is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. Sida polyantha is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
